com.arjuna.JDBC
Class JDBCResource

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.arjuna.ArjunaCore.Atomic.StateManager
        |
        +--com.arjuna.JDBC.JDBCResource
All Implemented Interfaces:
ResourceOperations
public class JDBCResource
extends StateManager
implements ResourceOperations

JDBC does not use a two-phase commit protocol, and does not allow nested transactions. So, we do not require an implementation of SubtransactionAwareResource, and we could potentially have to raise heuristics.

Since:
JTS 1.2.4.

finalize in class StateManager

prepare

public Vote prepare()
             throws org.omg.CORBA.SystemException
Since JDBC 1.0 does not support 2-phase commit, we always return VoteCommit for prepare, and hope we can when commit called!
Specified by:
prepare in interface ResourceOperations

rollback

public void rollback()
              throws org.omg.CORBA.SystemException,
                     HeuristicCommit,
                     HeuristicMixed,
                     HeuristicHazard
Must remove prepare decision, if any. We record the heuristic decision all the time, although technically we need only do this if rollback is called after prepare has been invoked.
Specified by:
rollback in interface ResourceOperations

save_state

public boolean save_state(OutputObjectState os,
                          int ot)
Description copied from class: StateManager
These methods must be used by a derived class. They are responsible for packing and unpacking an object's state to/from a state buffer. StateManager calls them at appropriate times during the lifetime of the object, and may then pass the buffer to a persistent object store for saving.
Overrides:
save_state in class StateManager
Following copied from class: com.arjuna.ArjunaCore.Atomic.StateManager
Returns:
true on success, false otherwise.
